document.title: Looking for an expression in a text
document.paragraph:
To find a word or an expression in a text, you can use the
../../../reference/10_browsing_tools/60_search_tool.xml search tool . If it is not displayed, you can make it appear by clicking on its icon
/images/eiffelstudio/icons/icon_search_text_color.gif in the tool bar. This tool will allow you to search a word or an expression with wildcards ("?" or "*") and to replace it if you want to. It can be case sensitive and look for isolated words.
Note: The
../../../reference/10_browsing_tools/60_search_tool.xml search tool will look for the wanted word in the editor or in the context tool, depending on which one has the focus.
Tip: There are several accelerators that will make it even easier to perform a search. They are detailed in the
../../../reference/20_editor/50_search_functionality.xml editor help .
